meanings.definition: To fill or crowd with people or things.
meanings.sent1: The stadium becrowds with excited fans during the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The market becrowds with shoppers on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The classroom becrowds with laughter when the teacher tells a joke.
meanings.sent4: The garden becrowds with colorful flowers in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The city square becrowds with protesters demanding change.

meanings.definition: To gather in a large group.
meanings.sent1: The birds becrowds in the sky before migrating south for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The students becrowds in the cafeteria during lunch break.
meanings.sent3: The ants becrowds around the dropped piece of candy.
meanings.sent4: The clouds becrowds in the sky before a storm.
meanings.sent5: The tourists becrowds at the famous landmark to take photos.
